fullText: Crystal is magnetic, funny and surprisingly moving as Buddy Young Jr., a Borscht Belt comic trying to make it big in the early days of television.

bwwExcerpt: There's one thing to kvetch about with "Mr. Saturday Night": it would be better as a straight play than a song-and-dance show. Jason Robert Brown has composed a bland point-A-to-point-B score that's not as hilarious or textured as the text. Similar to "Tootsie" before it, the star here is the scenes, not the tunes.
